sourcing.instructions: Cs (Cesium Carbonate) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Na (Sodium) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Ni (Nickel) - metal supply stores or online suppliers; Se (Selenium) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers.
steps: Cs (Cesium Carbonate) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Na (Sodium) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers; Ni (Nickel) - metal supply stores or online suppliers; Se (Selenium) - chemical supply stores or online suppliers.

1. Weigh out 6.36 g of Cesium Carbonate, 1.18 g of Sodium, 11.18 g of Nickel, and 64.64 g of Selenium using a precision balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed materials. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a glass rod to ensure uniform distribution of the ingredients. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ceramic crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 6.36 g of Cesium Carbonate, 1.18 g of Sodium, 11.18 g of Nickel, and 64.64 g of Selenium using a precision balance. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the weighed materials. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a glass rod to ensure uniform distribution of the ingredients. 4. Transfer the mixed powder to a ceramic crucible suitable for high-temperature applications.

steps: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800째C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature at 800째C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a muffle furnace to 800째C. 2. Place the ceramic crucible containing the mixture into the furnace. 3. Maintain the temperature at 800째C for 4 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the desired compound.

steps: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it reaches a safe handling temperature to avoid thermal shock.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 4 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). 2. Do not open the furnace until it reaches a safe handling temperature to avoid thermal shock.

steps: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Remove the solidified material from the crucible and inspect for uniformity. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Optionally, sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Store the final product in a moisture-free environment to prevent degradation.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible from the furnace using heat-resistant gloves. 2. Remove the solidified material from the crucible and inspect for uniformity. 3. If necessary, use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 4. Optionally, sand the edges to achieve a smooth finish. 5. Store the final product in a moisture-free environment to prevent degradation.
